result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J Ratliff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy J Ratliff in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.50(1m)(b), a class A Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve TEN (10) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for TEN (10) DAYS served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 03-14-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered WITH tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defense advises the Court that the Defendant has been unable to meet with his Probation agent due to a change in personnel.  Defense reports that the required drug testing has not ocurred.  Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy J Ratliff in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defense advises that Defendant has not been attending Drug testing.  Restitution will be paid by the next date.  Defense will follow-up with the DOC Agent regarding monitoring.  Review hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy J Ratliff in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
An updated report is needed.  Case adjourned for review hearing to Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy J Ratliff in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 08-17-2015 at 8:30 AM.

**All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Timothy J Ratliff in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Timothy J Ratliff in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
